summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Book of Eli
Review Date: 2016/02/04
Categories: Suspense, Drama, Bleak, Gritty
Product Description: ['A lone warrior (Denzel Washington) wanders the post-apocalyptic desert that was once America, battling lawlessness to realize his hope of a better future.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Allen Hughes', 'Albert Hughes'], 'Producers': ['Joel Silver', 'Denzel Washington', 'Broderick Johnson', 'David Valdes', 'Andrew A. Kosove'], 'Starring': ['Denzel Washington', 'Gary Oldman', 'Mila Kunis']}
Review Text: A bit violent for some, no doubt, but great acting and good story
Review Title: but great acting and good
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/07/03
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Yasuhiro Yoshiura'], 'Producers': ['Takanori Aki', 'Kei Hiroki', 'Tsutomu Nagae', 'Yoshifumi Nakano', 'Michiru Ohshima', 'Mikio Ono', 'Samuel Peralta', 'Masao Teshima'], 'Starring': ['Michael Sinterniklaas', 'Cassandra Lee Morris', 'Bill Lader'], 'Studio': ['GKIDS']}
Review Text: I loved it! Creative story!
Review Title: Great story!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/07/03
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ron Howard'], 'Producers': ['Brian Grazer', 'John Calley'], 'Starring': ['Tom Hanks', 'Audrey Tautou', 'Jean Reno']}
Review Text: Doesn't hold up to the book, but it's a pretty good movie
Review Title: Pretty good
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/07/25
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mike Judge'], 'Producers': ['Mike Judge', 'Elysa Koplovitz'], 'Starring': ['Luke Wilson', 'Maya Rudolph', 'Dax Shepard'], 'Studio': ['20TH CENTURY FOX']}
Review Text: I've given it 4 stars, not because I'm suggesting it falls in the same category with many other great movies, but for it's social commentary. It can be rather silly at times, with some classic B-movie antics, but it really does nail many aspects of social decline. Overall entertaining, with a few surprise laugh-out-loud moments.
Review Title: Great social commentary, with some pretty funny moments!
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/09/05
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ridley Scott'], 'Producers': ['Gordon Carroll', 'David Giler', 'Walter Hill'], 'Starring': ['Tom Skerritt', 'Sigourney Weaver', 'John Hurt'], 'Studio': ['20TH CENTURY FOX']}
Review Text: A few of the effects are dated, but it is amazing how well this 1979 movie stands the test of time. I guess a great movie is always just that.
Review Title: This classic stands the test of time
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/09/13
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dan Trachtenberg'], 'Producers': ['J. J. Abrams', 'Lindsey Weber', 'Bryan Burk', 'Drew Goddard', 'Matt Reeves'], 'Starring': ['John Goodman', 'Mary Elizabeth Winstead', 'John Gallagher Jr.'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']}
Review Text: Very exciting and suspenseful. Overall a good movie. Although my son disagrees with me, I thought the ending was kind of weak and could have been resolved better. The ending is a pretty jarring transition from the unreliable narrator, psychological suspense to a kind of action movie. I love the reality of the ending (the story line), I just don't think the movie pulls it off very well.
Review Title: Very suspenseful and exciting
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/09/13
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Matt Reeves'], 'Producers': ['Sherryl Clark', 'Guy Riedel', 'J. J. Abrams', 'Bryan Burk'], 'Starring': ['Lizzy Caplan', 'Jessica Lucas', 'T.J. Miller'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures Corp.']}
Review Text: Great movie! It's exciting, suspenseful and really a well done movie. However, the entire movie is filmed in the "amateur", shaky camera style. I was amazed that it did not make me nauseous, which this style often does, and I was surprised to find that I got so caught up in the story that I kind of forgot about the style. There are a few plot points that seem a little hard to believe, but overall a great and entertaining movie.
Review Title: Great entertainment
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/11/08
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Hettie Macdonald', "Daniel O'Hara", 'Ed Bazalgette', 'Daniel Nettheim', 'Justin Molotnikov', 'Rachel Talalay'], 'Producers': ['Tracie Simpson', 'Derek Ritchie', 'Nikki Wilson', 'Peter Bennett'], 'Starring': ['Peter Capaldi', 'Jenna Coleman', 'Michelle Gomez'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']}
Review Text: Capaldi is not Matt Smith or David Tennant, but those are incredibly difficult acts to follow, and he does brings something, I'm just not quite sure how to define it...  The story writing is as great as ever, so never fear, this is a great season!
Review Title: The story writing is as great as ever
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2017/01/08
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Paul Greengrass'], 'Producers': ['Frank Marshall', 'Jeffrey M. Weiner', 'Ben Smith', 'Matt Damon', 'Paul Greengrass', 'Gregory Goodman'], 'Starring': ['Matt Damon', 'Tommy Lee Jones', 'Alicia Vikander'], 'Studio': ['Universal Pictures']}
Review Text: Not up to the Bourne franchise standard. It had some great action, but was unfortunately, short on plot. I still give it 4 stars because it was certainly entertaining.
Review Title: Not great, but entertaining.
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Man in the High Castle
Review Date: 2017/01/23
Categories: Action, Drama
Product Description: ["Based on Philip K. Dick's award-winning novel, and executive produced by Ridley Scott (Blade Runner), and Frank Spotnitz (The X-Files), The Man in the High Castle explores what it would be like if the Allied Powers had lost WWII, and Japan and Germany ruled the United States. Starring Rufus Sewell (John Adams), Luke Kleintank (Pretty Little Liars), and Alexa Davalos (Mob City)."]
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English', 'English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['David Semel', 'Daniel Percival', 'Ken Olin', 'Michael Rymer', 'Bryan Spicer', 'Nelson Mccormick', 'Brad Anderson', 'Karyn Kusama', 'Michael Slovis'], 'Producers': ['Ridley Scott', 'David W. Zucker', 'Frank Spotnitz', 'Isa Dick Hackett', 'Christopher Tricarico', 'Stewart Mackinnon', 'Chrtistian Baute', 'Jace Richdale', 'Richard Heus', 'Dan Percival', 'Jordan Sheehan', 'Kalen Egan', 'Erin Smith'], 'Starring': ['Alexa Davalos', 'Rupert Evans', 'Luke Kleintank']}
Review Text: Very good!
Review Title: High quality production
Rating: 5.0

raw_response:
**Preferences & Patterns Summary:**

- **Genres:** Predominantly enjoys **suspense**, **drama**, and **action** films with a penchant for **dark** and **gritty** themes.
- **Content Adversity:** Comfortable with **violence**, **adult themes**, including **nudity**, and **foul language**.
- **Quality Over Quantity:** Values **strong storytelling** and **character development**, often giving high ratings for **great acting** and **creative narratives**, even if a film diverges from its source material.
- **Critical Viewpoint:** Displays a nuanced perspective, appreciating **social commentary** alongside entertainment, often acknowledging a film's shortcomings while still favoring it for overall engagement.
- **Repeat Engagement:** Engages with content from specific **directors** and **producers**, indicating a loyalty to their work, particularly those connected to thought-provoking narratives.
- **Time-Tested Enjoyment:** Deep appreciation for classics, often recognizing their lasting impact despite any aging effects.
- **Mixed Reviews:** Balances enthusiasm for aspects of various films with critical insights, allowing for various levels of enjoyment while maintaining high standards.

target_interaction.title: Loved it!
target_interaction.text: I really enjoyed this movie, and would highly recommend it!  But, recommendations are so subjective, I'm not sure how much good that will do you.  If you enjoyed "This is Spinal Tap", "Best in Show" or "Flight of the Concords", then you will most likely enjoy this.
